text: the 2008 Summer Olympic Games an English
lesson for the advanced student this is
part three and our focus now is grammar
skills
task 1 identifying verb tenses look at
each set of sentences identify the
requested verb tense example identify
the statement that uses the simple past
tense a I don't have a lot of time to
watch TV B no one had ever seen a
combination of technology and artistry
on that scale C on August 8th
thousands of lucky people crowded into
the Beijing National Stadium which of
the three statements uses the simple
past tense statement C crowded is in the
simple past tense crowd is a regular
verb so it takes the IDI ending question
1 identify the statement that uses the
simple present tense a I don't have a
lot of time to watch TV B no one had
ever seen a combination of technology
and artistry on that scale see China has
raised the bar for all other host cities
in the future answer statement a don't
have is an example of the simple present
tense this is the negative with all
verbs except the verb to be we make the
negative in the simple present tense
by using doesn't or don't plus the base
verb
question to identify the statement that
uses the present perfect tense a the
world would talk about the ceremony for
generations to come
B no one had ever seen a combination of
technology and artistry on that scale or
see China has raised the bar for all
other host cities in the future
the answer is C has raised as an example
of the present perfect tense
remember we formed this tense by using
have or has plus the past participle
that third form of the verb
question three identify the statement
that uses the past perfect tense a the
world would talk about the ceremony for
generations to come
B no one had ever seen a combination of
technology and artistry on that scale or
C dozens of dancers wore exquisite
costumes answer statement B had seen is
an example of the past perfect tense
remember we formed this tense by using
hat plus the past participle we can put
adverbs of frequency between pad and the
past participle questioned for identify
the statement with the future action
expressed in the past a the world would
talk about the ceremony for generations
to come B they had created a spectacular
event
C London has a tough act to follow and
the answer is statement a would talk is
a future action expressed in the past
this is would plus the base verb it's
the same structure we see in reported
speech for example let's say that the
filmmaker made a promise I will create a
spectacular event journalists can report
his speech and say the filmmaker
promised he would create a spectacular
event get it
tasks to understanding verb tenses what
do the different verb tenses Express
identify the reason why each verb tense
is used here's an example I am so happy
to have a DVR why is the simple present
tense used here a to express a regularly
performed action B to express a present
belief or opinion or C to express a
present emotional state the answer is C
a and B are reasons why we use the
simple present tense but they're not the
reasons why we use it in this statement
I am so happy expresses a present
emotional state question 1 before the
ceremony in Beijing no one had ever seen
a combination of Technology and artistry
on such a large scale why is the past
perfect tense used here a to express a
past action in progress B to refer to
the first of two passed points in time
or C to express an action completed in
the past the answer is B this is the
only reason why we use this tense a
colleague of mine likes to call this the
double past so the past perfect tense
tells us which of two points or periods
in the past came first question 2
everyone will compare the opening
ceremony to the one they saw in Beijing
why is the simple future tense used here
a to express a future promise B to
express a prediction or C to express a
general truth in the present the best
answer is B this is a future tense so C
is not a possibility that leaves us with
a and B the statement is more prediction
than a promise so the best answer is B
question three China has raised the bar
for all other host cities in the future
why is the present perfect tense used
here a to express a past action with an
effect on the present B to express an
action completed in the past or C to
express an action that started in the
past and continues to the present
the answer is a if we simply wanted to
express an action completed in the past
we could use the simple past tense this
leaves us with a choice of a or C and
the best one is a question for I don't
have a lot of time to watch TV why is
the simple present tense used here a to
express a present belief or opinion B to
express a general truth in the present
or C to express a regularly performed
action the answer is B all three are
possible reasons for using the simple
present tense but this is not a belief
or opinion and have is not an action
verb it's a non-action verb expressing
possession so the best answer is B
question 5 this month millions of people
around the world turned their attention
to Beijing China and watched the 2008
Summer Olympic Games why is the simple
past tense used here a to express a past
belief or opinion B to express a past
action in progress or C to express an
action completed in the past the answer
is C we are not emphasizing an action in
progress and this is not a belief or
opinion so the best answer is C
